description: Variation of condition 02 Ref: 24/03011/FUL to allow a reduction in excavation work, infill of ramp, reduction of depth of the building and alterations to the roof.
site_name: Bush Hill Park Bowls Tennis And Social Club
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the beginning of approved planning permission reference 24/03011/FUL dated 31st December 2024.Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:SI-000 - Site Location PlanSI-001 Rev A Site Block PlanMS5956 (Sheet 1 and 2) - Existing PlanGA-100-B -Ground floor block planGA-101-A - Roof planEL-200 - Front elevation - Section AAEL-201-A - Side elevation - Section EEEL-202-A - Section BB EL-203 - Section CCEL-203-A - Section C-CEL-204-A- Section DDEL-205-A - Section FF to HHEL-206-A Rear elevationSK-108 - SK-122 - CGI'S and MS5956 (Sheet 1 and 2)Arboricultural Impact Assessment Method Statement & Tree Protection Plan 21.08.24Energy StatementReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Sustainable Drainage Strategy (reference 25/00972/CND dated 08.05.2025) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plans detailing the existing and proposed ground levels (reference 25/00972/CND dated 08.05.2025) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved external lighting (reference 25/00972/CND dated 08.05.2025) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved green roof details(reference 25/00972/CND dated 08.05.2025) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

No plant or equipment shall be affixed to any external face of a building or added to the roof of abuilding other than that shown in the approved drawings.Reason: In the interest of amenity and to ensure a satisfactory external appearance in accordance withpolicy D4 of the London Plan (2021), CP30 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010) and DMD37 of theEnfield Development Management Policy (2014).

5 (a) Prior to the commencement of above ground works, the following details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority:i. External facing materials including sample boards of all facing materials and finishes as well assample panels;ii. External rainwater goods;iii. Typical sectional drawings at 1:20 through all typical external elements/facades, including allopenings in external walls including doors and window-type reveals, window heads and window sills(including fixing details);iv. Sectional and elevational drawings at 1:20 (where considered relevant) of junctions between differentexternal materials, parapets to roofs, photovoltaic arrays, roofs of cores, canopies, entrance areas,doors and where buildings meet the ground;v. Roof details;vi. Details of any rooftop plant, extract ducts and fans;vii. Plans of ground floor entrance cores at 1:20, elevations of entrance doors at 1:10 and details ofentrance door thresholds;Details shall be consistent with the approved Design and Access Statement and/or references tomaterials in approved drawings.(b) The required sample board(s) shall be made available on site for consideration by the LocalPlanning Authority and approved sample board(s) shall be retained on site for the duration of theconstruction of the building to which they relate.(c) The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory external appearance in accordance with policy D4 of the London Plan, CP30 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010) and DMD37 of the Enfield Development Management Policy(2014).

The approved development shall only be open for business and working between the hours of09:00 to 22:00 Monday to Fridays and 09:00 to 22:00 on Saturdays and 09:00 to 22:00 on Sundays orbank holidays.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of nearby residential properties.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (asamended) and the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or anystatutory instrument revoking and re-enacting these Orders, the approved development shall be usedfor sport and leisure only, and shall not be used for any other purpose.Reason: To ensure safeguarding and integrity of the application site.

Described in the Character Appraisal for Bush Hill Park as being built in the period 1896-1914 and with most of its original features intact.
